page.title: 06Brecon County Library.
page.content: The public library of Brecon was built in Brecon in{1957,}and took two years to build. It was near to the old library. It was built on Ship Street because of the central position there, and also it would be near to where the old library had been. It had cost Â£113,000 to build, and ocupies 16,180 sqaure feet, and has 3 floors. The building was built as a modern library, with more modern facilities, such as sound-proofing, and catering for minorities such as very young childern and invalids. 11 people work there,4 of them fully qualified, with degrees. They all work 37.5 hours a week. The books are ordered from Llandrindod where the Chief Libranian chooses them . Â£130,000 is spent on them each year and approx 7000 books are requested by card holders each year.
